title: 2026 T20 World Cup gets underway in Colombo today
byline: The 2026 ICC Men’s T20 World Cup is scheduled to get underway in Colombo today.

title: Showers above 50mm expected in parts of the island today
byline: Showers will occur at times in the Uva Province and in Matale, Nuwara-Eliya, Ampara and Batticaloa districts today (07), the Department of Meteorology stated.

title: Trump signs executive order threatening tariffs for countries trading with Iran
byline: US President Donald Trump has said he could impose additional tariffs on countries that continue to trade with Iran, in an executive order signed on Friday.

title: Trump signs executive order announcing removal of 25% penalty tariff on India for buying Russian oil
byline: United States President Donald Trump signed an executive order on Friday (local time), announcing that he will remove 25% tariff on India.

title: YouTube’s $60bn revenue revealed amid paid subscriber push
byline: Google has revealed YouTube brought in more than $60bn (£44bn) in revenue in 2025 as the firm targets getting more subscribers.

title: Fishermen continue ‘Satyagraha’ for third day over seine fishing ban
byline: The Satyagraha campaign launched by a group of fishermen demanding the lifting of the ban on the use of tractor-mounted winches for Madel (seine nets) fishing activities continued for the third consecutive day today.

title: Two women arrested at BIA over attempt to smuggle in 436 Anthurium plants
byline: Two Sri Lankan women were arrested in the early hours of this morning (07) for attempting to illegally smuggle a consignment of Anthurium plants valued at around Rs. 1 million into the country.

title: Over 400 drunk drivers arrested in daily police operations - Police
byline: Sri Lanka Police has stated that a total of 27,430 individuals were inspected yesterday (06) as part of the daily search operations carried out across the country.

title: 2026 Men’s T20 World Cup gets underway in Colombo today
byline: The 2026 ICC Men’s T20 World Cup is scheduled to get underway in Colombo today (07).

title: Parliamentary Pensions Repeal Bill to be debated and passed on Feb 17
byline: The Leader of the House, Minister Bimal Rathnayake, announced that the Parliamentary Business Committee has decided to take up the Parliamentary Pensions (Repeal) Bill for debate on 17 February and pass it on the same day.

title: Sri Lanka’s remittances exceed USD 750 mln in January
byline: Sri Lanka has received USD 751.1 million in workers’ remittances in January 2026, according to the latest figures released by the Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL).

title: Sri Lanka Police record higher drugs and weapons seizures in 2025 – IGP
byline: Inspector General of Police (IGP) Priyantha Weerasooriya stated that Sri Lanka Police recovered a significantly higher quantity of narcotics and weapons in 2025 compared to the previous year.

title: 103 children have lost one or both parents due to cyclone Ditwah – Minister
byline: Minister of Women and Child Affairs, Saroja Savithri Paulraj, stated that 103 children in Sri Lanka have lost a mother, father, or both parents due to the Cyclone Ditwah situation.

title: 22-hour water cut in several areas in Kandy District
byline: The National Water Supply and Drainage Board (NWSDB) announced that a 22-hour water cut will be implemented in several areas within the Kandy District from tomorrow (08) morning.

title: Sri Lanka’s tourist arrivals exceed 317,000 so far this year
byline: The Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority (SLTDA) reported that foreign tourist arrivals to Sri Lanka during the period elapsed in 2026 have exceeded 317,000.

title: Mother and teen daughter electrocuted to death in Galaha
byline: Police have reported that a mother and her daughter died after being electrocuted in the Kiribogahainna area of Navanaliya, Galaha.

title: Minister Nalinda outlines education reform plan up to Grade 9
byline: Minister of Health and Mass Media, Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa, has stated that the government’s education reforms will be implemented through five broad pillars, with reforms for other grades scheduled to be introduced over the next three years.

title: Three Swedish-made rocket launchers found buried in Batticaloa
byline: Three Swedish-made rocket launchers, believed to have been carefully buried underground by the LTTE during the war, has been discovered by security forces in the Kudumbimalai area of Batticaloa.

title: North Korea ‘executes schoolchildren for watching Squid Game’
byline: People in North Korea, including schoolchildren, are being executed for watching Squid Game and other foreign media, according to new testimony.

title: Advisory issued for severe lightning
byline: An ‘Amber’ advisory has been issued by the Department of Meteorology for severe lightning in the Western and Sabaragamuwa provinces and in Galle and Matara districts.

title: US wants Russia and Ukraine to end war by summer, Zelensky says
byline: The US wants Russia and Ukraine to find a solution on how to end the war, the largest since World War 2, before summer, says President Volodymyr Zelensky.

title: Youth beaten to death with cricket bat in Ratmalana
byline: A 21-year-old youth has been murdered after a dispute between two families living near the railway line in the Dharmarama Road area of Ratmalana escalated into an assault.

title: Excise trade unions agree to digitalization to enhance revenue collection
byline: All trade unions have expressed their agreement to the digitalisation and modernisation programme aimed at increasing excise revenue collection, according to the President’s Media Division (PMD).

title: Sri Lanka Police to set up dedicated Cybercrime Division - Minister
byline: Minister of Public Security and Parliamentary Affairs, Ananda Wijepala, stated that a decision has been taken to establish a new police division to combat cybercrime in Sri Lanka.

title: Russia turns to India, Sri Lanka for way out of its labour crisis – report
byline: For years, Russia relied on migrants from Central Asia to fill gaps in its workforce.

title: Steps have been taken to modernize Technical Colleges in all 25 Districts - PM
byline: A special discussion aimed at strengthening and modernizing Sri Lanka’s vocational education sector was held recently at the Parliamentary Complex under the patronage of Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya, according to the Prime Minister’s Media Division.
